Sentencas: Torch-substrate relative velocity is a plasma spray coating control parameter that affects lamellar thickness, heat transfer from the torch to the substrate, splat dispersion, and segmentation crack density.
Titulo: Utilizing torch-substrate relative velocity to reduce segmentation crack density in plasma sprayed zirconia for solid oxide cell applications

Sentencas: Within the thermal barrier coating and solid oxide fuel cell/solid oxide electrolysis literature, plasma sprayed coatings are rarely fabricated with velocities that exceed similar to 2 m s(-1).
Titulo: Utilizing torch-substrate relative velocity to reduce segmentation crack density in plasma sprayed zirconia for solid oxide cell applications

Sentencas: Here, we explore the effect of torch-substrate relative velocities in the range of 4-20 m s(-1) on crack density in thin (10-15 mu m) solid oxide cell electrolyte coatings.
Titulo: Utilizing torch-substrate relative velocity to reduce segmentation crack density in plasma sprayed zirconia for solid oxide cell applications

Sentencas: Crack densities were observed to drop from similar to 2.4 to similar to 0.04 mm(-1) by increasing the torch-substrate relative velocity from 4 to 16 m s(-1).
Titulo: Utilizing torch-substrate relative velocity to reduce segmentation crack density in plasma sprayed zirconia for solid oxide cell applications

Sentencas: In agreement with previous studies performed at lower velocities, crack densities correlate well with plasma torch heat impulse.
Titulo: Utilizing torch-substrate relative velocity to reduce segmentation crack density in plasma sprayed zirconia for solid oxide cell applications

Sentencas: Full cells were fabricated using torch-substrate relative velocities of 12-20 m s(-1).
Titulo: Utilizing torch-substrate relative velocity to reduce segmentation crack density in plasma sprayed zirconia for solid oxide cell applications
